alert.note: Alert for Logan; Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:43AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mingo and southern Logan Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 842 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buskirk, or near Williamson, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Man, Delbarton, Mallory, Amherstdale-Robinette, Red Jacket, Aflex, Hinch, Holden, Matewan, Chauncey, Myrtle, Hampden, Switzer, Pie, Bruno, Varney, Amherstdale-Robine, Sarah Ann and Meador. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 11 and 16, and between mile markers 18 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
